Description: Rim sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; greyish white slip; interior: narrow reserved band at rim, glazed black below; lotus flower and palmette chain in added red and white; exterior: at rim, band of short vertical strokes between pairs of bands; below, painted decoration consisting of head and hands of woman holding two pomegranates to right (white flesh and headdress with white dots).
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Grey-Slip Group. The sherds in this group have a characteristically grey coloured slip. The sherd may well belong to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.479, though the heads are a little smaller.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 112, p. 276, no. 735, pl. II, pl. 96)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 43.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0790) (phase 2)
